Guide to the Shirley Hayes Papers

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Jan Hilley and Tiffany Schureman

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-10-25T15:59-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Shirley Hayes was a long-time resident of the Washington Square Park area. While she lived there she was active in many local community groups. This collection contains information on the activities she was involved in, her political involvement, and her job at WNYC.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.) See guidelines in Reading room for details.
This collection should be cited as the Shirley Hayes Papers, The New-York Historical Society.
In 2001, the Parks Department of New York City honored Hayes with a plaque in Washington Square Park. The plaque tells of her fight to close the park to traffic. Hayes passed away on May 6, 2002.

The collection contains a wide variety of materials including correspondence, reports, press releases, statements and speeches, petitions, photographs, maps, flyers, posters, receipts and other financial documents, clippings, audio and videotape, political campaign materials, handwritten notes and drafts, publications, and personal ephemera.

dsc.value:
Series I: Washington Square Park Battle, 1952-1959 Scope and Contents note

This series contains three sub-series. It contains a variety of material from the fight to close Washington Square Park to traffic and housing issues from various community organizations. Materials included are minutes, reports, financial documents, press releases, correspondence, speeches, petitions, and surveys.

 Subseries 1: Washington Square Park Committee Scope and Contents note

This sub-series contains materials from the Washington Square Park Committee, a committee formed to discuss issues related to Washington Square Park. Hayes was a founding member of this committee and was chairperson. The types of materials included are minutes, reports, mailings, financial documents, and press releases.

 General Correspondence: Received by Shirley Hayes/Washington Square Park Committee 1 1 1952-1954 General Correspondence: Received by Shirley Hayes/Washington Square Park Committee 1 2 1955-1961 General Correspondence: Received by Shirley Hayes/Washington Square Park Committee 1 3 Undated General Correspondence: Sent by Shirley Hayes/Washington Square Park Committee 1 4 1952-1954 General Correspondence: Sent by Shirley Hayes/Washington Square Park Committee 1 5 1955-1657 General Correspondence: Sent by Shirley Hayes/Washington Square Park Committee 1 6 1958-1959, Undated Other Correspondents 1 7 1956-1959, Undated Meeting Minutes 1 8 1952-1954, Undated Reports 1 9 1953-1955 Financial Documents 1 10 1951-1956 Financial Documents 1 11 1957 Financial Documents 1 12 1958 Financial Documents 1 13 1959-1960 Financial Forms, Notes, and Alienated Envelopes 1 14 1956, Undated Press Releases and Associated Materials 2 1 1953-1957 Press Releases and Associated Materials 2 2 1958-1959, Undated Traffic Issues in NYC and Around the Nation - Articles and Notes 2 3 1955-1959, Undated Traffic - Transportation Consultant Correspondence 2 4 1958 Traffic - Survey 2 5 1958-1959, Undated Speeches and Transcripts 2 6 1952-1958, Undated Statements regarding Washington Square Park 2 7 1952-1958, Undated Washington Square Park - Letter and Speech Drafts 2 8 Undated Washington Square Park - Notes and Fragments 2 9 1958, Undated Meeting Attendees Lists 2 10 1957-1958, Undated Neighborhood "Master Lists" 2 11 1957, Undated Lists of Individuals and Organizations (1 of 2) 3 1 1952-1958, Undated Lists of Individuals and Organizations (2 of 2) 3 2 1955-1958, Undated Mailings 3 3 1952-1958, Undated Drafts 3 4 1952-1959, Undated Returned Mail Used to Update Mailing Lists 3 5 1955, 1958, Undated Unsent Mail 3 6 1955, 1959, Undated Washington Square Park and Joint Emergency Committee - Letterhead 3 7 Undated Washington Square Park and Joint Emergency Committee - Envelopes 3 8 Undated Subseries 2: Community Campaigns and Support Scope and Contents note

This sub-series contains letters sent and received from individuals and community organizations in support of closing the park to traffic. Also included are petitions to close the park to traffic.

 Letters - Individuals and Organizations 4 1 1952 Letters - Political Candidates 4 2 1953 Letters - Individuals 4 3 1953-1954, Undated Letters - Schools, PTAs, Churches 4 4 1953-1954, Undated Letters - Individuals 4 5 1955, Undated Letters - Schools 4 6 1955 Letters - Schools and Churches 4 7 1958 Citizens Union 4 8 1954-1958, Undated Consents 4 9 1952 Petitions 4 10 1953 Tearoff Campaign 4 11 1955 Tearoff Campaign 4 12 Undated Post Card Campaign 4 13 1957 Subseries 3: Other Community Groups Scope and Contents note

Sub-series three contains records of various other Greenwich Village area community groups in which Hayes was involved in. The types of materials included are correspondence, press releases, minutes, newsletters, posters, and clippings. This sub-series contains letters sent and received from individuals and community organizations in support of closing the park to traffic. Also included are petitions to close the park to traffic.

 Joint Emergency Committee 5 1 1958, Undated Greenwich Village Association 5 2 1953-1959, Undated Washington Square Association 5 3 1952-1956, Undated Various Other Community Groups 5 4 1953-1958, Undated Series II: Washington Square Park Renovation Effort, 1958-1969 Scope and Contents note

In this series is material relating to renovating the park after it was closed to traffic. Hayes led the movement to renovate the park. The types of materials included are maps, surveys, correspondence, drafts, and clippings.

 Campaign to Renovate Park 5 5 1958-1966, Undated Washington Square Park Renovation Clippings 5 6 1969 Series III: Greenwich Village Battles, 1960-1993 Scope and Contents note

Many other issues surrounding Washington Square Park and Greenwich Village area are included in this series, including removing the buses from the park and fighting the construction of New York University's library. The materials contained in the series are letters, statements, announcements, and newsletters.

 Final Removal of Buses from Washington Square Park 5 7 1960-1963, Undated NYU Library Controversy 5 8 1961-1966, Undated Other Village Issues and Involvement 5 9 1960-1973, Undated NYU Attempt to Close Washington Place 5 10 1993, Undated Series IV: Greenwich Village/Washington Square Park -Histories, 1988 Scope and Contents note

This series contains a draft of a manuscript although it does not indicate who wrote it. The series also contains information on a history workshop Hayes spoke at. The types of materials are letters, flyers, speech notes, newsletters and a video.

 Untitled Manuscript 6 1 Undated Washington Square History Workshop - Flyers and Speech Drafts 6 2 1988 Washington Square History Workshop Video 6 3 1988 Series V: Community Planning Board #2, 1952-1993 Scope and Contents note

This series contains the records of Community Planning Board #2. Hayes was a committee member and member of the Parks and Playground Committee, which was a part of Community Planning Board #2. Materials included are minutes, flyers, petitions, maps, correspondence, and reports. There is a gap in the records of the minutes from 1965 to 1974.

 Meeting Minutes 6 4 1952-1953 Meeting Minutes 6 5 1954-1955 Meeting Minutes 6 6 1956-1958 Meeting Minutes 6 7 1959-1960 Meeting Minutes 6 8 1961-1962 Meeting Minutes 6 9 1965 Meeting Minutes 6 10 1974 Meeting Minutes 7 1 1975 Parks and Playground Committee 7 2 1954-1955, Undated P.A.L. - NYU Playground 7 3 1952-1956, Undated 6th Avenue Playground 7 4 1953-1954, Undated P.S. 3 Playground 7 5 1954-1955, Undated Abingdon Square Park 7 6 1959-1966, Undated Various Planning Board Activities 7 7 1952-1993, Undated Traffic Issues 7 8 1966, Undated Original Members, Early Minutes, and 25th Anniversary Celebration 7 9 1951-1977, Undated Village Real Estate Redevelopment 7 10 1952-1959, Undated Village and Park Maps 7 11 1952-1966, Undated Greenwich Village Association Housing Committee Findings, Report and Handbook 7 12 1959 Statistical Guide to Greenwich Village 7 13 1968 Greenwich Village: Statistical Trends and Observations 8 1 1969 Board of Estimate Calendar 8 2 1953 Board of Estimate Calendar 8 3 1958 Board of Estimate Calendar 8 4 1959 Community Planning Handbook 8 5 1974 Series VI: City Publications, 1952-1993 Scope and Contents note

The records contained in this series are city publications relating to living in New York City. Also included is one folder (Box 1, Folder 3) on regional planning.

Gans Co., Inc. 9 4 1952-1953 Eviction Regulations 9 5 1957, Undated Statistical Guide for New York City, Dept. of Commerce and Industrial Development 9 6 1965 People and Plans: Vest Pocket Housing - The First Step in New York's Model Cities Program, Housing Development Administration 9 7 1967 Brooklyn Progress - Annual Report, Office of President, Borough of Brooklyn, City of New York 9 8 1968-1969 Towards Effective Citizen Planning, Testimony by John E. Zuccotti, Chairman NYC Planning Commission before the State Charter Revision Commission for NYC 9 9 1973 Group Homes in New York City, Marge Benjamin and Louis Murray, Dept. of City Planning 9 10 1973 Greenwich Village Auto Free Zone - Draft, Department of City Planning 9 11 1993 Various City Planning Newsletters, Pamphlets, Flyers, Press Releases, and Other Materials 10 1 1969 Various City Planning Newsletters, Pamphlets, Flyers, Press Releases, and Other Materials 10 2 1970-1976, Undated Regional Planning Brochures 10 3 1967-1976, Undated Series VII: Political Campaigns, 1952-1969 Scope and Contents note

Hayes was involved in local politics and helped on several election campaigns. In this series are her records of her activities in the campaigns and information on local politics. The materials included are campaign materials, notes, press releases, newsletters, correspondence and clippings.

 Local Politics 10 4 1952-1964, Undated Lists and Election Returns 10 5 1965-1968, Undated Campaign 1964- John Lindsay, Congressional Re-election 10 6 1964, Undated Campaign 1965- John Lindsay, Mayoral Election 10 7 1964, Undated Campaign 1965- Entertainment: Correspondence, Releases, Block Parties, Lindsay 'Hops' 10 8 1965, Undated Campaign 1965- Entertainment: Notes, Lists, Clippings 10 9 1965, Undated Campaign 1965- Campaign Literature, Lindsay and Other Candidates 10 10 1965, Undated Mayoral Primaries 11 1 1969, Undated Mayoral Campaign - Re-election Releases, Events, Campaign Literature, and Contributions 11 2 1969, Undated Mayoral Campaign - Re-election Correspondence, Notes, Clippings, Staff List, Voters Directory 11 3 1969, Undated Lindsay Re-election Poster 18 7 Undated Series VIII: WNYC, American Federation of Television and Radio Arts (AFTRA) and Related Materials, 1960-1978 Scope and Contents note

Hayes starting working at WNYC in 1966 as an announcer. This series contains records from her time there and also from AFTRA. The materials included are program highlights, press releases, reports and annual convention material. Also included are some AFTRA publications.

 WNYC 11 4 1967-1978, Undated AFTRA 11 5 1960, 1968-1969 AFTRA 11 6 1979, Undated AFTRA Publications 12 1 1977-1979, Undated National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences Ballots 12 2 1964-1969, Undated Series IX: : Other Organizations, Events, Activities and Issues of Interest to Shirley Hayes, 1951-1976 Scope and Contents note

Series nine contains information on other interests of Hayes, including education, children, libraries, and women's interests. The types of materials included are minutes, correspondence, newsletters, ballots, and clippings.

 Citizens Committee on Children of NYC, Inc. 12 3 1951-1955, 1961, Undated Education - City and Country Schools, including Community Affairs Committee and Student Publications 12 4 1952-1961, Undated Education - Interschool Committee / Councils 12 5 1949-1953, Undated Education - Public Education Association 12 6 1953-1961, Undated Education in General 13 1 1953-1966, Undated Higher Education 13 2 1957-1967, Undated Child Rearing and Juvenile Delinquency - Newspaper Clippings 13 3 1956,1966, Undated Libraries 13 4 1956,1965 Women's City Club of New York - Publications 13 5 1956,1965 Waterfront Issues: Minutes, Reports, Memos, Press Releases and Flyers 13 6 1966-1967 Waterfront Issues: Minutes, Reports, Memos, Press Releases and Flyers 13 7 1968-1976, Undated Waterfront Issues: Publications 13 8 1966-1974 Correspondence regarding "Shirley Hayes Circle" - Effort to Have Center of Washington Square Park Named for Hayes 13 9 1984 "Puerto Rico and Us" - Pamphlet 13 10 [1953] Ideology and Co-Existence: Moral Re-Armament - Booklet 13 11 1959 This is the Truth!- Brotherhood's Committee's Reply to The Villager - Announcement 13 12 1960 Greenwich Village Parade Flyer 13 13 1960 Let the World Aid America - The Trade Expansion Act of 1962 - Statement 13 14 1962 After Robert Moses, What? - An Exploration of New Ways of Governing Cities and Institutions - Brochure 13 15 1975 New York Landmarks - Pamphlet 13 16 Undated Advertisement for Victor M. Villemain 13 17 Undated Castle Clinton Restoration - Description 13 18 Undated Series X: Personal Items, 1948-2001 Scope and Contents note

This series contains personal correspondence written to and from Hayes, resumes, clippings relating to personal interests, ephemera, and items her children copied to include. Most of the material included in folder six is available in other series in the collection.

 Personal Correspondence 13 19 1952-1989, Undated Newspaper Clippings 13 20 1948-1974, Undated Ephemera - Children's School Materials, Flyers, Receipts, Pamplets, Ads 14 1 1957-1965, Undated Resumes and Associated Materials, Including Obituary Notes 14 2 1967-1998, Undated Materials Selected for Resumes - Articles, Clippings, Drafts 14 3 1952-1976, Undated Surprise Party - Washington Square Park Committee 14 4 1959, Undated "L'Affaire Gold Key" - Honor from The Villager Hayes Did Not Accept 14 5 1959, Undated Shirley Hayes Plaque Materials - Washington Square Park 14 6 2000-2001, Undated Copies of Various Items Selected by Hayes' Children 14 7 1952-1998, Undated Series XI: Articles and Clippings, 1952-1980 Scope and Contents note

This series contains articles and clippings from newspapers and magazines relating to Washington Square Park and other interests of Hayes.

Newspaper Clippings - Letters to the Editor 16 2 1953-1959, Undated Newspaper Clippings 16 3 1960-1973 Village Newspaper Clippings 16 4 1961-1965 Waterfront Issues: Clippings 16 5 1966-1980, Undated Lindsay Victory - Newspaper Clippings 16 6 1965 Lindsay Victory - Newspaper Clippings 16 7 1969 Newspaper Clippings 16 8 Undated Efforts to Keep Folksingers in the Park and Prohibit Sightseeing Buses from Parking around the Park 16 9 Undated Newspaper Clippings Fragments 16 10 1952-1963, Undated Series XII: Visual Materials, 1952-1993 Scope and Contents note

This series contains visual materials related to Washington Square Park and the traffic plans. The types of materials included are photos, maps, art prints, posters and a banner. Some of these materials are oversized and are located in three oversized boxes (Box 18, 19, and 20), separate from Box 16.

 Washington Square Park - Contact Sheets 16 11 Undated Washington Square Historic Photos 16 12 Undated "Washington Square" by Carl Mueller - Print 16 13 Undated Washington Square Park Plans 16 14 1952, Undated "The Villager Historic Series No. 1" - Grove Court - Print 18 1 1993 Site Plan - Title 1 - Washington Square South East - Plans 18 2 Undated Parks Department Washington Square Park Plan 18 3 1935 Washington Square Park Plan Prints 18 4 1954, Undated Washington Square Park Arch Mockup Photo 18 5 Undated Washington Square Park Plan Photostats and "Save Washington Square Park" Poster 18 6 Undated "Save Washington Square Park" Banner - Meeting of Board of Estimate - Sept. 18th 19 [1958] John Lindsay Campaign Poster and Poster Mockup for "Save Washington Square Park" (Oversized) 20 Undated Series XIII: Recordings Scope and Contents note

This series contains one reel of recordings about "Saving Washington Square Park".

 "Saving Washington Square Park" 17 1 Undated Series XIV: Notes, Drafts, and Fragments, 1953-1967 Scope and Contents note

This series includes drafts of letters and speeches written about the activities Hayes was involved in.

 Various Other Notes, Drafts and Fragments 17 2 Undated Alienated Envelopes 17 3 1953-1967, Undated
